alert.note: Alert for Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Central Black Hills; Custer County Plains; Eastern Foot Hills; Fall River County Area; Haakon County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Northern Foot Hills; Pine Ridge Area; Southern Black Hills; Tripp County; West Central Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 1:54PM MDT until April 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 320, 321, 322, 323, 324, 325, 326, 329, 331, 332, 333, 334, AND 335... .Strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuels will continue through the day. Relative humidity will rise this evening and overnight as precipitation begins to move into the area. However, the very strong winds will continue through the night and Wednesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 320, 321, 322, 323, 324, 325, 326, 329, 331, 332, 333, 334, AND 335... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell, 316 Crook County Plains, 317 Weston County Plains, 320 Central Black Hills, 321 Southern Black Hills, 322 Fall River County Area, 323 Northern Foot Hills, 324 Eastern Foot Hills, 325 Custer County Plains, 326 Pine Ridge Area, 329 West Central Plains, 331 Haakon County Area, 332 Badlands Area, 333 Bennett County Area, 334 Mellette and Todd Counties and 335 Tripp County. * WINDS...Northwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Central Black Hills; Custer County Plains; Eastern Foot Hills; Fall River County Area; Haakon County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Northern Foot Hills; Pine Ridge Area; Southern Black Hills; Tripp County; West Central Plains
